articles.content:
The last quarter of the year is always a busy and exciting time, full of events and opportunities to meet. For me, it means the chance to travel, share knowledge, and connect with incredible people who are part of our vibrant Cloud Native community.

As a Developer Advocate at Mia-Platform and CNCF Ambassador, I have the privilege of participating in events where I can not only share my ideas and discuss innovation but also meet professionals with diverse backgrounds and expertise. This continuous exchange of ideas is one of the most rewarding aspects of my job: each event is an opportunity to learn, network, and build lasting relationships. Reconnecting with old friends and meeting new talents in the community is what makes these gatherings special.

## The Growing Cloud Native Community

What I appreciate the most is the energy and enthusiasm that fills these events. The Cloud Native community is continuously growing, becoming more vibrant and stimulating. Actively participating allows me not only to contribute my expertise but also to receive valuable feedback, learn from others, and discover new perspectives. This spirit of sharing drives technological progress and strengthens the bond between those working in this field.

## My Event Schedule Until October

I’m excited to share that the next few months are packed with events where I’ll be speaking, and I truly hope to meet you there. If you’ll be attending any of these, don’t hesitate to stop by and chat with me about Platform Engineering, Cloud Native, sustainability, or any other tech-related topic. Here’s my schedule until October:

- **KCD Porto** - September 27-28, 2024
_Talk: "Sustainability in Cloud Native: strategies and tools for a green future"_
I will discuss sustainability in the Cloud Native context, focusing on the strategies and tools we can adopt to reduce the environmental impact of technology.
[Link](https://community.cncf.io/events/details/cncf-kcd-porto-presents-kcd-porto-2024/)

- **Cloud Native London** - October 2, 2024
_Talk: "How to build a Conversational DevX interface using RAG"_
In this talk, I will explore how we can improve Developer Experience through artificial intelligence by building conversational interfaces using Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG).
[Link](https://www.meetup.com/cloud-native-london/events/300767226)

- **Container Day Bologna** - October 10, 2024
_Talk with Sara Trappetti: "Navigating the CNCF Landscape: One Piece at a Time"_
Together with Sara Trappetti, we will guide the audience through the complex CNCF landscape, helping participants navigate and discover the most relevant technologies.
[Link](https://2024.containerday.it/)

- **BetterSoftware Bologna** - October 11, 2024
_Talk: "Sustainability and Cloud Native: strategies and tools for a green future"_
Another talk focused on sustainability, with a specific emphasis on how Cloud Native can contribute to building a greener technological future.
[Link](https://2024.bettersoftware.it/)

- **Cloud Native Bergen (Norway)** - October 30, 2024
_Talk: "Enhanced Developer Experience in a Cloud Native world"_
I will focus on how to enhance Developer Experience in an increasingly Cloud Native world, exploring technologies and practices that can make developers’ lives easier and more efficient.
[Link](https://2024.cloudnativebergen.dev/)

## An Invitation to Conversation

Attending these events isn’t just an opportunity to speak, but also to listen. I truly enjoy exchanging ideas, discussing new trends, and exploring how we can continue to innovate. I look forward to meeting new members of the community, hearing their stories, and discovering what drives their passion for technology.

If you see me at one of these events, don’t hesitate to stop by! I’d love to chat about any topic that interests you: Platform Engineering, Cloud Native, tech innovation, or simply how we can build a better and more sustainable future together.

See you soon!

metadata.title: Reflections and connections on the road to October 2024
metadata.excerpt: The last quarter of the year is packed with events where I'll be speaking as a Developer Advocate and CNCF Ambassador. Discover my schedule and join me to chat about Platform Engineering, Cloud Native, and tech innovation!

articles.content:
I am thrilled to share my experience as [one of the organizers](https://community.cncf.io/kcd-italy/) of the Kubernetes Community Day Italy (KCD Italy). This event, supported by the CNCF (Cloud-Native Computing Foundation) and organized by the Italian Kubernetes community, was a remarkable moment of connection, learning, and inspiration.

The true heart of KCD Italy is the community. Organizing such an event, by the community for the community, has been an incredibly rewarding experience. We saw around 300 participants come together to share knowledge, stories, and innovations in the Open Source and Cloud-Native technologies. The sense of belonging and the desire to contribute to collective growth were palpable in every corner of the Savoia Regency Hotel in Bologna on June 20, 2024.

We had the privilege of listening to established experts, emerging figures, and enthusiasts from the Cloud-Native world. The talks ranged from ephemeral clusters as a service, to the challenges of building a cloud for AI, to adventures in security. Each presentation offered valuable insights and sparked vibrant discussions among the participants.

One of the most beautiful aspects of KCD Italy was the networking. The sponsor areas and coffee breaks were ideal moments to forge new friendships, discuss projects, and exchange innovative ideas. The Kubernetes community is truly special: open, inclusive, and always ready to support each other.

I would like to thank everyone who participated and made this event possible. The speakers, with their inspiring presentations, the sponsors who supported the event, and of course all the participants who, with their energy and passion, created a unique atmosphere. It was truly exciting to see so many people united by the same passion for Kubernetes and Cloud-Native technologies.

Organizing an event of this magnitude requires commitment and dedication, but seeing the enthusiasm and interest of the participants was the greatest reward. We look forward to seeing how the community will grow and evolve in the coming year, and we are already excited for the 2025 edition.

Thank you all from the bottom of my heart for making KCD Italy 2024 an unforgettable success. Keep sharing, learning, and growing together. See you next time!

A special thanks to [Mia-Platform](https://www.mia-platform.eu) for giving me the opportunity to actively contribute to the realization of this event.

For more details about the organizers and the event, visit [this page](https://kcd.pizza/).
If you want to stay updated on all the latest news, you can also follow us on [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/company/kcditaly/) and [X (formerly Twitter)](https://x.com/kcditaly)

metadata.title: KCD Italy 2024: an event from the community to the community
metadata.excerpt: The Kubernetes Community Day Italy 2024 was an extraordinary event with 300 participants, prominent speakers, and numerous networking opportunities. An incredible experience organized by the community for the community, rich in knowledge and innovations in the Cloud-Native world.
metadata.author: Michel Murabito

articles.content:
Hello everyone! I'm **Michel Murabito**, but everyone calls me **Mich** (pronounced *Mitch*), a fervent Developer Advocate at **Mia-Platform**, with my roots deeply embedded in the beautiful land of Sicily and my heart beating in the fast-paced rhythm of Milan.

## Who I Am

Born in Turin in 1986 and raised under the sun of Sicily, I started writing code at the age of 12, driven by curiosity and a passion for technology that still fuels every day of my life. My professional career kicked off at 18 as a software developer, and since then, I've never stopped exploring new horizons in the vast world of IT.

## What I Do

Today, I find myself in the role of Developer Advocate at **Mia-Platform**, where I have the opportunity to merge my passion for technology with that for communication, working closely with the developer community. My goal is to make developers' lives simpler and more productive, through sharing knowledge, experiences, and best practices.

## My Passions

Beyond my professional commitment, I am deeply involved in promoting sustainability in IT, a theme I consider crucial for the future of our planet and our industry. I am also an active contributor to the open source community, a staunch supporter of continuous learning, and a passionate speaker at national and international tech events.

### A Deeper Dive into My Interests

My enthusiasm doesn't stop there; I am particularly passionate about **Cloud Native technologies, Platform Engineering, and enhancing the Developer Experience**. These fields represent the cutting edge of creating scalable, resilient, and efficient software solutions. They are also about building communities and ecosystems where developers can thrive, innovate, and deliver outstanding value rapidly and reliably.

## Why a Blog?

I've decided to start this blog to share my reflections, discoveries, and experiences on this journey through the world of technology. Here you'll find articles on platform engineering, sustainability, advocacy, and much more.

I invite every reader to interact, share opinions, and experiences: I firmly believe in the value of community and constructive dialogue.

Thank you for taking the time to read these lines. I'm excited about embarking on this path with you.

Until next time!
Mich
